result.post_video_description: Actors dressed in traditional Qing dynasty costumes including yellow and blue robes with hats gather in a palace courtyard with red walls and ornate architecture. Emperor Kangxi in black hat and robe points and speaks authoritatively amid princes like the Eighth in yellow attire gesturing emphatically. The Thirteenth Prince in blue uniform argues with others in embroidered silk garments. Subtitles display tech jargon such as focusing on core and strategic layout in Chinese. A comedic brawl ensues with exaggerated punches and shouts among the group. No watermarks from other platforms visible.

result.post_video_description: Dashcam footage from inside a Tesla vehicle during nighttime driving in Boston using Full Self-Driving software version 14.1.3. Displays the central touchscreen showing navigation maps roads and 2x speed indicator. Shows urban streets with buildings traffic lights and other cars in low light conditions. Steering wheel and purple ambient lighting visible. Includes highway driving and city navigation sequences with smooth autonomous maneuvers. Captures a curbside drop-off attempt and backing out from a dead-end street.

legacy.description: EV/space/tech news. Bringing you the latest news in a single, easy-to-read feed. $TSLA investor & Model Y owner.

result.text:
I just got back from over 3 hours of driving to and around Boston using @Tesla FSD V14.1.3. No interventions. It was great. V14 is ready to be released wide in my opinion.

It feels noticeably smoother and more comfortable in everyday driving compared to 14.1.2. That's especially impressive since I tested 14.1.3 in Boston at night, while V14.1.2 was only tested in southern New Hampshire (less challenging).

I only noticed one minor hesitation at a stoplight and one issue during a curbside drop-off at the start of this video, where it circled the block once before pulling over in the correct area, but both were not a big deal. I had no safety issues tonight. There was also an interesting moment in the video where I accidentally set the curbside drop-off area in a dead end street. FSD took a little while figuring out how to back out, but it eventually did it without my help.

If you'd like to watch the 4K version of this video on YouTube, I've linked that in the thread below.

result.text:
At CHTC, we are committed to providing you with a permanent and natural solution for your hair loss.

At CHTC, we stay ahead of the curve by investing in state of the art facilities and sparing no expense when it comes to getting the best results possible for our patients. Dr. Panine utilizes ATPv, Hypo Thermasol, EXPARELÂ® and other expensive medications/consumables during each hair transplant surgery because in order to get the best results, you have to give patients the best during their procedure. Unlike other clinics we do not try to upcharge you for these items.

At CHTC, we only perform hair restoration procedures. Many surgeons perform a wide range of cosmetic surgeries on various parts of the body. Our surgeon, Dr. Panine, exclusively focuses on hair transplant surgeries.

At CHTC, Dr. Panine performs every single surgery. Unlike other clinics, hair transplant technicians are NOT performing your surgery at CHTC.

At CHTC, we perform ONE hair transplant surgery per day. You can't give patient's the best results unless you focus on one patient per day. Clinics that perform multiple surgeries per day have their focus divided and their results show it; you want a custom build, not an assembly line.

With CHTC, you don't have to accept your hair loss. You can reclaim your self-esteem and confidence.

It's time for you to explore your options. Schedule your free consultation with Dr. Panine today at https://t.co/xpuPPaLbGe.

result.text:
Tutorial on how to configure GLM 4.6 in Claude Code (bookmark it)

1. Install the latest Claude Code
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code

2. Create an account in https://t.co/HdaY3pn8sx and buy a coding plan at $3/mo. You can always upgrade later! Use my link https://t.co/stdhC6Fw9o to save 10%

3. Create an API key here https://t.co/GWDxZ7Lr6t. Copy the key and paste it in a text editor

4.  Edit ~/.claude/settings.json. Paste this. Make sure you update it with the new api key you created

{
    "env": {
        "ANTHROPIC_AUTH_TOKEN": "your_zai_api_key",
        "ANTHROPIC_BASE_URL": "https://t.co/4LeP3uIpNz",
        "API_TIMEOUT_MS": "3000000",
        "ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_HAIKU_MODEL": "glm-4.5-air",
        "ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_SONNET_MODEL": "glm-4.6",
        "ANTHROPIC_DEFAULT_OPUS_MODEL": "glm-4.6"
    }
}

5. Switching between Claude Plans and GLM, try this
https://t.co/aOg4Izzlip. I haven't tried this because I just use GLM

6. Run Claude Code and enjoy!

result.text:
We're testing a new link experience, starting on iOS -- to make it easier for your followers to engage with your post while browsing links.

For creators, a common complaint is that posts with links tend to get lower reach. This is because the web browser covers the post and people forget to Like or Reply. So X doesn't get a clear signal whether the content is any good.

To help get better signal, posts will now collapse to the bottom of the page so people can react while you're reading.

As always, remember: the post should stand alone as great content so write a solid caption.
